standard_metadata.standard_description: Write, interpret, and explain statements of order for rational numbers in real-world contexts.

question.content: The temperature is $-18.2~^{\circ}\text{C}$ in South Dakota and $-9.7~^{\circ} \text{C}$ in Minnesota.   **Which one of the following inequalities correctly compares the temperatures?**    **Which one of the following descriptions is correct?**

options.content: The temperature is warmer in South Dakota than in Minnesota.
The temperature is warmer in Minnesota than in South Dakota.

hints.content: Let's place the two temperatures on a number line.    [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line with 3 tick marks that are unevenly spaced. A solid point labeled South Dakota is plotted at negative 18.2. A solid point labeled Minnesota is plotted at negative 9.7. A tick mark is labeled 0.

hints.content: $-9.7 \pink> -18.2$ because $-9.7$ is to the $\pink{\text{right}}$ of $-18.2$.
The temperature is $\pink{\text{warmer}}$ in Minnesota than in South Dakota because $-9.7$ is $\pink{\text{greater}}$ than  $-18.2$.
The correct answers are given below:  - $-9.7 > -18.2$   - The temperature is warmer in Minnesota than in South Dakota.

question.content: Desert Shores has an elevation of $-61.2$ meters. Shatt al Gharsah has an elevation of $-17.1$ meters. Note that both places have negative elevations because they are below sea level.   **Which one of the following inequalities correctly compares the elevations?**    **Which one of the following descriptions is correct?**

options.content: Desert Shores has a lower elevation than Shatt al Gharsah.
Shatt al Gharsah has a lower elevation than Desert Shores.

hints.content: Let's place the two elevations on a number line.   [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line with 3 tick marks that are unevenly spaced. A closed point labeled Desert Shores is plotted at negative 61.2. A closed point labeled Shatt al Gharsah is plotted at negative 17.1. A tick mark is labeled 0.

hints.content: $-61.2 \pink< -17.1$ because $-61.2$ is to the $\pink{\text{left}}$ of $-17.1$.
Desert Shores has a $\pink{\text{lower}}$ elevation than Shatt al Gharsah because $-61.2$ is $\pink{\text{less}}$ than  $-17.1$.
The correct answers are given below:  - $-61.2 < -17.1$   - Desert Shores has a lower elevation than Shatt al Gharsah.

question.content: The Sea Lions are facing off against The Otters in fantasy football. The Sea Lions scored $-12$ points this week. The Otters scored $-17$ points this week.  **Which one of the following inequalities correctly compares the scores?**    **Which one of the following descriptions is correct?**

options.content: The Otters' score was higher than The Sea Lions' score.
The Sea Lions' score was higher than The Otters' score.

hints.content: [[☃ image 1]]  Let's place the two scores on a number line.

images.alt: A number line with 3 tick marks that are unevenly spaced. A closed point labeled Otters is plotted at negative 17. A closed point labeled Sea Lions is plotted at negative 12. A tick mark is labeled 0.

hints.content: $-12 \pink> -17$ because $-12$ is to the $\pink{\text{right}}$ of $-17$.
The Sea Lions' score was $\pink{\text{higher}}$ than The Otters' score because $-12$ is $\pink{\text{greater}}$ than $-17$.
The correct answers are given below:  - $-12 > -17$   - The Sea Lions' score was higher than The Otters' score.

question.content: Nathaniel, a meteorologist, keeps track of the amount of rain each year relative to the amount of rain in $2000$. Two years of data are shown in the table below.   Year | Amount of rain relative to $2000$ (in $\text{cm}$) - | :-:  $2004$ | $27$ $2005$ | $-49$    **Which one of the following inequalities correctly compares the relative amounts of rain?**    **Which one of the following descriptions is correct?**

options.content: There was less rain in $2005$ than in $2004$.
There was less rain in $2004$ than in $2005$.

hints.content: Let's place the two relative amounts of rain on a number line.    [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line with 3 tick marks that are unevenly spaced. A closed point labeled 2005 is plotted at negative 49. A tick mark is labeled 0. A closed point labeled 2004 is plotted at 27.

hints.content: $-49 \pink< 27$ because $-49$ is to the $\pink{\text{left}}$ of $27$.
There was $\pink{\text{less}}$ rain in $2005$ than in $2004$ because $-49$ is $\pink{\text{less}}$ than $27$.
The correct answers are given below:  - $-49 < 27$   - There was less rain in $2005$ than in $2004$.

question.content: LeBron keeps track of events in his life relative to the year he was born. Relative to when he was born, his brother was born in year $-3$, and his family moved in year $7$.   **Which one of the following inequalities correctly compares the relative years?**     **Which one of the following descriptions is correct?**

options.content: LeBron's brother was born after his family moved.
LeBron's family moved after his brother was born.

hints.content: Let's place the two relative years on a number line.    [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line with 3 tick marks that are unevenly spaced. A closed point labeled Brother born is plotted at negative 3. A tick mark is labeled 0. A closed point labeled Family moved is plotted at 7.

hints.content: $7 \pink> -3$ because $7$ is to the $\pink{\text{right}}$ of $-3$.
LeBron's family moved $\pink{\text{after}}$ his brother was born because $7$ is $\pink{\text{greater}}$ than $-3$.
The correct answers are given below:  - $7 > -3$   - LeBron's family moved after his brother was born.

question.content: Sophia has $\$146.32$ in her savings account. She has $-\$212.19$ in her checking account.  **Which one of the following inequalities correctly compares the account values?**    **Which one of the following descriptions is correct?**

options.content: Sophia's checking account has a lower account value than her savings account.
Sophia's savings account has a lower account value than her checking account.

hints.content: Let's place the two account values on a number line.    [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line with 3 tick marks that are unevenly spaced. A closed point labeled Checking account is plotted at negative 212.19. A tick mark is labeled 0. A closed point labeled Savings account is plotted at 146.32.

hints.content: $-212.19 \pink< 146.32$ because $-212.19$ is to the $\pink{\text{left}}$ of $146.32$.
Sophia's checking account has a $\pink{\text{lower}}$ account value than her savings account because $-212.19$ is $\pink{\text{less}}$ than  $146.32$.
The correct answers are given below:  - $-212.19 < 146.32$   - Sophia's checking account has a lower account value than her savings account.

question.content: Lilou's Diner has a value of $1.73$ million dollars. Mitch's Bed and Breakfast has a value of $-0.29$ million dollars.  **Which one of the following inequalities correctly compares the company values?**    **Which one of the following descriptions is correct?**

options.content: Lilou's Diner has a greater value than Mitch's Bed and Breakfast.
Mitch's Bed and Breakfast has a greater value than Lilou's Diner.

hints.content: Let's place the two company values on a number line.    [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line with 3 tick marks that are unevenly spaced. A closed point labeled Mitch's Bed and Breakfast is plotted at negative 0.29. A tick mark is labeled 0. A closed point labeled Lilou's Diner is plotted at 1.73.

hints.content: $1.73 \pink> -0.29$ because $1.73$ is to the $\pink{\text{right}}$ of $-0.29$.
Lilou's Diner has a $\pink{\text{greater}}$ value than Mitch's Bed and Breakfast because $1.73$ is $\pink{\text{greater}}$ than $-0.29$.
The correct answers are given below:  - $1.73 > -0.29$   - Lilou's Diner has a greater value than Mitch's Bed and Breakfast.

question.content: The table below shows the number of text messages Eduardo sent during two months. Negative values represent the number of text messages he was under his allotted amount, and positive values represent the number of text messages he was over.   Month | Number of text messages - | :-:  April | $53$ May | $-18$     **Which one of the following inequalities correctly compares the relative numbers of text messages?**    **Which one of the following descriptions is correct?**

options.content: Eduardo sent fewer text messages during May than April.
Eduardo sent fewer text messages during April than May.

hints.content: Let's place the two relative numbers of text messages on a number line.    [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line with 3 tick marks that are unevenly spaced. A closed point labeled May is plotted at negative 18. A tick mark is labeled 0. A closed point labeled April is plotted at 53.

hints.content: $-18 \pink< 53$ because $-18$ is to the $\pink{\text{left}}$ of $53$.
Eduardo sent $\pink{\text{fewer}}$ text messages during May than April  because $-18$ is $\pink{\text{less}}$ than $53$.
The correct answers are given below:  - $-18 < 53$   - Eduardo sent fewer text messages during May than April.

question.content: A red bird is flying at an elevation of $17 \dfrac19$ meters. A blue bird is flying at an elevation of $10 \dfrac35$ meters.  **Which one of the following inequalities correctly compares the elevations?**    **Which one of the following descriptions is correct?**

options.content: $17 \dfrac19 > 10 \dfrac35$
$10 \dfrac35 > 17 \dfrac19$
The red bird is flying at a higher elevation than the blue bird.
The blue bird is flying at a higher elevation than the red bird.

hints.content: Let's place the two elevations on a number line.    [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line with 3 tick marks that are unevenly spaced. A tick mark is labeled 0. A closed point labeled Blue bird is plotted at 10 and 3 fifths. A closed point labeled Red bird is plotted at 17 and 1 ninth.

hints.content: $17 \dfrac19 \pink> 10 \dfrac35$ because $17 \dfrac19$ is to the $\pink{\text{right}}$ of $10 \dfrac35$.
The red bird is flying at a $\pink{\text{higher}}$ elevation than the blue bird because $17 \dfrac19$ is $\pink{\text{greater}}$ than $10 \dfrac35$.
The correct answers are given below:  - $17 \dfrac19 > 10 \dfrac35$   - The red bird is flying at a higher elevation than the blue bird.

question.content: The temperature is $-5.5~^{\circ}\text{C}$ in New York and $-11.1~^{\circ} \text{C}$ in Iowa.   **Drag the white cards onto the gray rectangle to write an inequality that correctly compares the temperatures.**    **Which one of the following descriptions is correct?**

options.content: The temperature is warmer in Iowa than in New York.
The temperature is warmer in New York than in Iowa.

hints.content: Let's place the two temperatures on a number line.    [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line with 3 tick marks that are unevenly spaced. There are 3 labeled points from left to right. A closed point labeled Iowa is plotted at negative 11.1. A closed point labeled New York is plotted at negative 5.5. A tick mark is labeled 0.

hints.content: $-5.5 \pink> -11.1$ because $-5.5$ is to the $\pink{\text{right}}$ of $-11.1$.
The temperature is $\pink{\text{warmer}}$ in New York than in Iowa because $-5.5$ is $\pink{\text{greater}}$ than $-11.1$.
The correct answers are given below:  - $-5.5 > -11.1$   - The temperature is warmer in New York than in Iowa.

question.content: The Cayman trough has an elevation of $-7\dfrac{7}{10}$ kilometers.  The Mariana trench has an elevation of $-10\dfrac{9}{10}$ kilometers. Note that both places have negative elevations because they are below sea level.   **Drag the white cards onto the gray rectangle to write an inequality that correctly compares the elevations.**    **Which one of the following descriptions is correct?**

options.content: The Cayman trough has a lower elevation than the Mariana trench.
The Mariana trench has a lower elevation than the Cayman trough.

hints.content: Let's place the two elevations on a number line.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line with 3 tick marks that are unevenly spaced. There are 3 labeled points from left to right. A closed point labeled Mariana trench is plotted at negative 10 and 9 tenths. A closed point labeled Cayman trough is plotted at negative 7 and 7 tenths. A tick mark is labeled 0.

hints.content: $- 10 \dfrac{9}{10} \pink< - 7 \dfrac{7}{10}$ because $- 10 \dfrac{9}{10} $ is to the $\pink{\text{left}}$ of $- 7 \dfrac{7}{10}$.
The Mariana trench has a $\pink{\text{lower}}$ elevation than the Cayman trough because $- 10 \dfrac{9}{10}$ is $\pink{\text{less}}$ than $- 7 \dfrac{7}{10}$ .
The correct answers are given below:  - $- 10 \dfrac{9}{10} < - 7 \dfrac{7}{10}$    - The Mariana trench has a lower elevation than the Cayman trough.

question.content: The Red Robins are facing off against the Aliens in fantasy football. The Red Robins scored $39$ points this week. The Aliens scored $-25$ points this week.  **Drag the white cards onto the gray rectangle to write an inequality that correctly compares the scores.**    **Which one of the following descriptions is correct?**

options.content: The Red Robins' score was higher than the Aliens' score.
The Aliens' score was higher than the Red Robins' score.

hints.content: Let's place the two scores on a number line.    [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line with 3 tick marks that are unevenly spaced. There are 3 labeled points from left to right. A closed point labeled Aliens is plotted at negative 25. A tick mark is labeled 0. A closed point labeled Red Robins is plotted at 39.

hints.content: $39 \pink> -25$ because $39$ is to the $\pink{\text{right}}$ of $-25$.
The Red Robins' score was $\pink{\text{higher}}$ than the Aliens' score because $39$ is $\pink{\text{greater}}$ than $-25$.
The correct answers are given below:  - $39 > -25$   - The Red Robins' score was higher than the Aliens' score.

question.content: Manueala scored $-4 \dfrac12$ points relative to her season average against the China Dragons. She scored $1 \dfrac12$ points relative to her season average against the Canada Moose.  **Drag the white cards onto the gray rectangle to write an inequality that correctly compares Manueala's relative numbers of points.**    **Which one of the following descriptions is correct?**

options.content: Manueala scored more points against the China Dragons than against the Canada Moose.
Manueala scored more points against the Canada Moose than against the China Dragons.

hints.content: Let's place the two relative numbers of points on a number line.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line with 3 tick marks that are unevenly spaced. There are 3 labeled points from left to right. A closed point labeled China Dragons is plotted at negative 4 and 1 half. A tick mark is labeled 0. A closed point labeled Canada Moose is plotted at 1 and 1 half.

hints.content: $1 \dfrac12\pink> -4 \dfrac12$ because $1 \dfrac12$ is to the $\pink{\text{right}}$ of $-4 \dfrac12$.
Manueala scored $\pink{\text{more}}$ points against the Canada Moose than against the China Dragons because $1 \dfrac12$ is $\pink{\text{greater}}$ than $-4 \dfrac12$.
The correct answers are given below:  - $1 \dfrac12> -4 \dfrac12$   - Manueala scored more points against the Canada Moose than against the China Dragons.

question.content: Hunter, a meteorologist, keeps track of the amount of rain each year relative to the amount of rain in $1900$. Two years of data are shown in the table below.   Year | Amount of rain relative to $1900$ (in $\text{cm}$) - | :-:  $1945$ | $-19$ $1946$ | $36$   **Drag the white cards onto the gray rectangle to write an inequality that correctly compares the relative amounts of rain.**    **Which one of the following descriptions is correct?**

options.content: There was less rain in $1945$ than in $1946$.
There was less rain in $1946$ than in $1945$.

hints.content: Let's place the two relative amounts of rain on a number line.    [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line with 3 tick marks that are unevenly spaced. There are 3 labeled points from left to right. A closed point labeled 1945 is plotted at negative 19. A tick mark is labeled 0. A closed point labeled 1946 is plotted at 36.

hints.content: $-19 \pink< 36$ because $-19$ is to the $\pink{\text{left}}$ of $36$.
There was $\pink{\text{less}}$ rain in $1945$ than in $1946$ because $-19$ is $\pink{\text{less}}$ than $36$.
The correct answers are given below:  - $-19 < 36$  - There was less rain in $1945$ than in $1946$.

question.content: Hailey has $\$117.39$ in her savings account. She has $-\$121.06$ in her checking account.  **Drag the white cards onto the gray rectangle to write an inequality that correctly compares the account values.**    **Which one of the following descriptions is correct?**

options.content: Hailey's checking account has a higher account value than her savings account.
Hailey's savings account has a higher account value than her checking account.

hints.content: Let's place the two account values on a number line.    [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line with 3 tick marks that are unevenly spaced. There are 3 labeled points from left to right. A closed point labeled Checking account is plotted at negative 121.06. A tick mark is labeled 0. A closed point labeled Savings account is plotted at 117.39.

hints.content: $117.39 \pink> -121.06$ because $117.39$ is to the $\pink{\text{right}}$ of $-121.06$.
Hailey's savings account has a $\pink{\text{higher}}$ account value than her checking account because $117.39$ is $\pink{\text{greater}}$ than $-121.06$.
The correct answers are given below:  - $117.39 > -121.06$   - Hailey's savings account has a higher account value than her checking account.

question.content: Ming's Lodge has a value of $-0.51$ million dollars.   Felipe's Restaurant has a value of $-0.89$ million dollars.  **Drag the white cards onto the gray rectangle to write an inequality that correctly compares the company values.**    **Which one of the following descriptions is correct?**

options.content: Felipe's Restaurant has less value than Ming's Lodge.
Ming's Lodge has less value than Felipe's Restaurant.

hints.content: Let's place the two company values on a number line.   [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line with 3 tick marks that are unevenly spaced. There are 3 labeled points from left to right. A closed point labeled Felipe's Restaurant is plotted at negative 0.89. A closed point labeled Ming's Lodge is plotted at negative 0.51. A tick mark is labeled 0.

hints.content: $-0.89 \pink< -0.51$ because $-0.89$ is to the $\pink{\text{left}}$ of $-0.51$.
Felipe's Restaurant has $\pink{\text{less}}$ value than Ming's Lodge because $-0.89$ is $\pink{\text{less}}$ than $-0.51$.
The correct answers are given below:  - $-0.89 < -0.51$   - Felipe's Restaurant has less value than Ming's Lodge.

question.content: A marvellous spatuletail is flying at an elevation of $4 \dfrac29$ meters. An Asian crested ibis is flying at an elevation of $10 \dfrac14$ meters.  **Drag the white cards onto the gray rectangle to write an inequality that correctly compares the elevations.**    **Which one of the following descriptions is correct?**

options.content: The marvellous spatuletail is flying at a lower elevation than the Asian crested ibis.
The Asian crested ibis is flying at a lower elevation than the marvellous spatuletail.

hints.content: Let's place the two elevations on a number line.   [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line with 3 tick marks that are unevenly spaced. There are 3 labeled points from left to right. A tick mark is labeled 0. A closed point labeled Marvellous spatuletail plotted at 4 and 2 ninths. A closed point labeled Asian crested ibis is plotted at 10 and 1 fourth.

hints.content: $4 \dfrac29 \pink< 10 \dfrac14$ because $4 \dfrac29$ is to the $\pink{\text{left}}$ of $10 \dfrac14$.
The marvellous spatuletail is flying at a $\pink{\text{lower}}$ elevation than the Asian crested ibis because $4 \dfrac29$ is $\pink{\text{less}}$ than $10 \dfrac14$.
The correct answers are given below:  - $4 \dfrac29 < 10 \dfrac14$   - The marvellous spatuletail is flying at a lower elevation than the Asian crested ibis.

question.content: Giovanna has a score of $-5$ in Canasta. Vera's score is $-10$.   **Write an inequality that correctly compares the scores.**  $\qquad$  **Which one of the following descriptions is correct?**

options.content: Giovanna's score is higher than Vera's score.
Vera's score is higher than Giovanna's score.

hints.content: Let's place the two scores on a number line.    [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line with 3 tick marks that are unevenly spaced. There are 3 labeled points from left to right. A closed point labeled Vera is plotted at negative 10. A closed point labeled Giovanna is plotted at negative 5. A tick mark is labeled 0.

hints.content: Either of the following inequalities will work:  $-10 < -5$ because $-10$ is to the left of $-5$.  $-5 > -10$ because $-5$ is to the right of $-10$.
Giovanna's score is higher than Vera's score because $-5$ is greater than $-10$.
The correct answers are given below:  - $-10 < -5$ or $-5 > -10$   -  Giovanna's score is higher than Vera's score.

question.content: The temperature on Tuesday was $-5~^{\circ}\text{C}$. The temperature on Wednesday was $5~^{\circ}\text{C}$.  **Write an inequality that correctly compares the temperatures.**  $\qquad$  **Which one of the following descriptions is correct?**

options.content: The temperature was higher on Tuesday than on Wednesday.
The temperature was higher on Wednesday than on Tuesday.

hints.content: Let's place the two temperatures on a number line.   [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line with 3 tick marks that are unevenly spaced. A closed point labeled Tuesday is plotted at negative 5. A tick mark is labeled 0. A closed point labeled Wednesday is plotted at 5.

hints.content: Either of the following inequalities will work:  $-5 < 5$ because $-5$ is to the left of $5$.  $5 > -5$ because $5$ is to the right of $-5$.
The temperature was higher on Wednesday than on Tuesday because $5$ is greater than $-5$.
The correct answers are given below:  - $-5 < 5$ or $5 > -5$   -  The temperature was higher on Wednesday than on Tuesday.

question.content: The electric charge of magnesium  is $2$. The electric charge of potassium is $1$.   **Write an inequality that correctly compares the charges.**  $\qquad$  **Which one of the following descriptions is correct?**

options.content: Magnesium's charge is more positive than potassium's charge.
Potassium's charge is more positive than magnesium's charge.

hints.content: Let's place the two charges on a number line.   [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line with 3 tick marks that are unevenly spaced. A tick mark is labeled 0. A closed point labeled Potassium is plotted at 1. A closed point labeled Magnesium is plotted at 2.

hints.content: Either of the following inequalities will work:  $1 < 2$ because $1$ is to the left of $2$.  $2 > 1$ because $2$ is to the right of $1$.
Magnesium's charge is more positive than potassium's charge because $2$ is greater than $1$.
The correct answers are given below:  - $1 < 2$ or $2 > 1$   -  Magnesium's charge is more positive than potassium's charge.

question.content: Bajo del Gualicho has an elevation of $-72$ meters. Lago Enriquillo has an elevation of $-46$ meters. Note that both places have negative elevations because they are below sea level.   **Write an inequality that correctly compares the elevations.**  $\qquad$  **Which one of the following descriptions is correct?**

options.content: Bajo del Gualicho has a higher elevation than Lago Enriquillo.
Lago Enriquillo has a higher elevation than Bajo del Gualicho.

hints.content: Let's place the two elevations on a number line.    [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line with 3 tick marks that are unevenly spaced. A closed point labeled Bajo del Gualicho is plotted at negative 72. A closed point labeled Lago Enriquillo is plotted at negative 46. A tick mark is labeled 0.

hints.content: Either of the following inequalities will work:  $-72 < -46$ because $-72$ is to the left of $-46$.  $-46 > -72$ because $-46$ is to the right of $-72$.
Lago Enriquillo has a higher elevation than Bajo del Gualicho because $-46$ is greater than $-72$.
The correct answers are given below:  - $-72 < -46$ or $-46 > -72$   -  Lago Enriquillo has a higher elevation than Bajo del Gualicho.

question.content: Wang Xiu Ying has $109$ dollars in her savings account. She has $-21$ dollars in her checking account.  **Write an inequality that correctly compares the account values.**  $\qquad$  **Which one of the following descriptions is correct?**

options.content: Wang Xiu Ying's checking account has a lower account value than her savings account.
Wang Xiu Ying's savings account has a lower account value than her checking account.

hints.content: Let's place the two account values on a number line.    [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line with 3 tick marks that are unevenly spaced. A closed point labeled Checking account is plotted at negative 21. A tick mark is labeled 0. A closed point labeled Savings account is plotted at 109.

hints.content: Either of the following inequalities will work:  $-21 < 109$ because $-21$ is to the left of $109$.  $109 > -21$ because $109$ is to the right of $-21$.
Wang Xiu Ying's checking account has a lower account value than her savings account because $-21$ is less than $109$.
The correct answers are given below:  - $-21 < 109$ or $109 > -21$   -  Wang Xiu Ying's checking account has a lower account value than her savings account.

question.content: An eagle is flying at an elevation $15$ meters above the ground. A gyrfalcon is flying at an elevation $23$ meters above the ground.  **Write an inequality that correctly compares the elevations.**  $\qquad$  **Which one of the following descriptions is correct?**

options.content: The eagle is flying at a lower elevation than the gyrfalcon.
The gyrfalcon is flying at a lower elevation than the eagle.

hints.content: Let's place the two elevations on a number line.   [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line with 3 tick marks that are unevenly spaced. A tick mark is labeled 0. A closed point labeled Eagle is plotted at 15. A closed point labeled Gyrfalcon is plotted at 23.

hints.content: Either of the following inequalities will work:  $15 < 23$ because $15$ is to the left of $23$.  $23 > 15$ because $23$ is to the right of $15$.
The eagle is flying at a lower elevation than the gyrfalcon because $15$ is less than $23$.
The correct answers are given below:  - $15 < 23$ or $23 > 15$    -  The eagle is flying at a lower elevation than the gyrfalcon.
